entry.title: Rusty Radio - The first Rust-lang Podcast
entry.summary:
I love my podcasts and this being Rust's first podcast means that I just had to try it. It features a great mix of speakers from the rust world; many of whom are on the core team. Both of the first two episodes are long enough to allow for some pretty in depth discussion about a few topics each. The topics, so far, have generally related to libraries that the speakers themselves have been working on (both within the core of the rust language and outside of it). This leads to a hearty mix of language-specific topics as well interesting discussions on the new libraries coming out daily. The hosts of the show do a great job of steering the conversation so that even a Rust novice (such as myself) may follow.

My only qualm? The lack of podcast logo means that it looks very ugly in my podcatcher.

Find the show here.

entry.title: Converting a String of Binary to an Integer
entry.summary:
Earlier in the week I needed to take four u8s assembled in a Vec<u8> and combine them to form a u32. The tricky part was that the needed to be concatenated and then converted in binary form.

Documentation seems a little scarce on the topic and what I could find either had to cast an integer represented in decimal or no longer existed. I'm looking at you std::num::from_str_radix. I leapt onto the IRC to ask there.

Turns out that from_str_radix wasn't that far off and it seems to have been refactored to another place in the codebase. Without further ado:

u32::from_str_radix(somestr, 2)

This turns a (correctly formatted) string slice into a integer, or floating point, of your choosing: u8, u16, u32, u64, i8, i16, i32, i64, f32 or f64.
